intro: Tephrosia linearis var. linearis, commonly known as the slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, cylindrical stems and opposite, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow to white in color, with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. The species is notable for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural insecticides.
